page.title: 07Local History,Earlston
page.content: In the 13th century{Thomas the Rhymer, a poet and prophet,whose real name was Thomas Learmont,lived in Rhymer's Tower which is now a ruin.He made many predictions.The legend of True Thomas tells how he was taken away by the Fairy Queen to Elfland where he wasn't to speak for seven years.The Queen gifted him with a tongue which would never lie.This earned him the name of True Thomas. He then returned to his home where local people could hardly believe what they saw.Later in his life he was called back by the Fairy Queen when two white deer came to his tower. There is a plaque in his memory on the church wall and also a plaque on the ruined tower.
